title: Logged on for the first time in a year to a permaban
body:
Hey, so this is pretty random but I was wondering if someone could give me a hand.

I haven't played League in probably two years. At some stage last year I tried to play League again and so I contacted Riot support about getting my account back (because I couldn't remember some details about my account). I logged in but I don't think I played a game.

Anyhow, I got the urge to play again today and so I updated the client and went to log in, only to find out I'm permabanned. There's also an email in my Inbox about it. Anyways, there's no explanation as to what I did to get the ban but the ban was apparently made a while after I got access to my account back but a very long time after I'd last played a game.

It sucks because I have quite a number of skins. 

Any ideas why?

replies.body:
It's likely the account was compromised and used for something like scripting which got it banned.

Submit an account recovery ticket to player support and they ought to be able to help you out: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Lemme know if you need a hand with any part of the process :)

> Lemme know if you need a hand with any part of the process :)

According to the match history the account hasn't been used to play a game since 2016... well before I asked Riot support to retrieve the account, which is interesting. 

I've already submitted a report under the suspension system just tonight. I'll wait and see.
I am in a similar situations to you, what was the email about that you received? try making a support ticket, an answer can take a while but you will get one.

The email didn't cite any reason - just said I was permanently suspended until the year 2100 and that it was because of something severe. Not sure why, since the account technically hadn't been used to play a game in almost a year.
well 18 days later whats happened I'm interested?
